summary: This is a forwarded email chain discussing the Metropolitan Correctional Center's (MCC) accidental release of a serial bank robber, Michael Matthews, days before Jeffrey Epstein's death. The document highlights serious security failures and poor conditions at the MCC, contributing to the scrutiny following Epstein's apparent suicide.

persons.name: Nicole Darrah
persons.context: Fox News reporter who authored the article about the MCC's accidental release of Michael Matthews and the circumstances surrounding Epstein's death.

persons.name: Michael Matthews
persons.context: A 58-year-old serial bank robber who was accidentally released from the Metropolitan Correctional Center on August 7, 2019, while awaiting sentencing.

persons.name: Richard Donoghue
persons.context: U.S. Attorney for the Eastern District of New York who wrote a letter confirming Matthews's erroneous release and stating the government was seeking more information.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The 66-year-old financier who died from an apparent suicide in his MCC cell on August 10, 2019, after being left alone for hours.

persons.name: William Barr
persons.context: The U.S. Attorney General who vowed a full investigation into the federal prison following Epstein's death, expressing he was 'appalled' and 'angry' at the MCC's failures.

persons.name: Nicholas Tartaglione
persons.context: A former police officer and one of Epstein's former cellmates, charged in 2016 with four murders related to an alleged cocaine conspiracy. His lawyer described poor conditions at MCC.

persons.name: Bruce Barket
persons.context: Attorney for Nicholas Tartaglione who criticized conditions at the MCC, describing them as 'border on inhumane' and run with 'laziness and cruelty.'

connections.description: Tartaglione is identified as one of Epstein's former cellmates at the Metropolitan Correctional Center.
Bruce Barket is the lawyer representing inmate Nicholas Tartaglione.
U.S. Attorney Richard Donoghue is the government official investigating and confirming the circumstances of inmate Michael Matthews's erroneous release.

events.title: Accidental Release of Michael Matthews
events.description: Serial bank robber Michael Matthews was 'accidentally released' from the Metropolitan Correctional Center in Manhattan despite a permanent detention order.

events.title: Death of Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was found dead in his MCC cell from an apparent suicide. He had been taken off suicide watch and was not physically checked on for several hours, violating protocol.

events.title: Matthews Surrenders
events.description: Michael Matthews surrendered to officials after being erroneously released from the MCC.

events.title: AG Barr Vows Investigation
events.description: Attorney General William Barr vowed a full investigation into the federal prison following Epstein's death, citing 'serious irregularities' at the MCC.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC), Manhattan, New York
Rikers Island jail, New York City
keyFacts: The Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) accidentally released serial bank robber Michael Matthews on August 7, 2019, while he was awaiting sentencing.
Jeffrey Epstein died in his MCC cell on August 10, 2019, from an apparent suicide after being left alone for hours, despite recently being on suicide watch.
Attorney General William Barr vowed a full investigation into the federal prison, stating he was 'appalled' and 'angry' at the MCC's failure to secure Epstein.
A lawyer for Epstein's former cellmate described MCC conditions as 'border on inhumane,' citing a rodent infestation and a 'bad combination of laziness and cruelty.'
A union representative decried low staff levels at MCC, calling it part of a 'system-wide crisis in our prison system.'
